message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.DS

The paper discusses the use of Support Vector Machines (SVM) for text classification, which falls under the categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and information retrieval (cs.IR). The paper specifically focuses on the use of kernels, which is a common technique in machine learning and falls under the category of computational learning theory (cs.LG). The paper also applies the SVM approach to text categorization using the Dewey Document Classification (DDC) scheme, which falls under the category of natural language processing (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of the Mahalanobis distance, which is a common technique in computer vision (cs.CV) and data science (cs.DS).
